item.title: "I entrust you with Palestine": A murdered Gaza journalist pleads amid his people’s erasure
item.author: Anas Al-Sharif
item.description: Israel succeeded in killing journalist Anas Jamal Al-Sharif, but it could not silence him. In this posthumous letter, he testifies against those who "accepted our killing," and entrusts his beloved daughter Sham, his son Salah, and the soul of his nation to a world he urges to finally act.

item.title: Julia Hartley-Brewer's racism is a common reality for brown man - I know, having experienced it firsthand
item.author: Ariana Yekrangi
item.description: Julia Hartley-Brewer's sexist and racist remarks to her guest, Mustafa Barghouti, reflect a troubling norm in many workplaces.

item.title: The Selective Outrage of the Tories: HS2 and Beyond
item.author: Ariana Yekrangi
item.description: The Tories have long been masters of selective indignation. This propensity to cherry-pick causes for criticism has been vividly illustrated by their recent stance on the HS2 high-speed rail line.

item.title: The Great Pretender: Boris Johnson's Deceptive Finale to his Controversial Tenure
item.author: Ariana Yekrangi
item.description: Boris Johnson's controversial tenure concludes with an evasive exit, leaving behind a legacy ripe for reform and questions about the ethics of leadership.

item.title: UN-aligned’s views on strikes in England: Laying the blame where it should be
item.author: Ariana Yekrangi
item.description: It's time to stand with essential workers and demand fair treatment and decent pay for their tireless efforts during the global crisis.

item.title: There is citizen journalism and there is The Gordian Magazine
item.author: Ariana Yekrangi
item.description: In a world that moves at a dizzying speed, sometimes towards the wrong direction, The Gordian has stayed true to its values, fighting for a better UN and bringing our readers the insights and information they need to stay informed and engaged.

item.title: Don’t let technology become a bane for future generations
item.author: Sailaja SP
item.description: The negative impact of technology, particularly on children, cannot be understated. For our wellbeing’s sake, we need a healthier balance, argues Sailaja.

item.title: Breaking the Glass Ceiling: Women in India are not Behind
item.author: Sailaja SP
item.description: In the late 20th century, women in other parts of the industrialised world had also experienced what is popularly known as the 'glass ceiling' phenomenon, which meant that women found they could only rise to a certain level in corporations and no further. This raises two immediate questions. What were the reasons that could have led to such a thought? And, were men keeping women away from the top?

item.title: UN-aligned’s view on the climate protests: the days of self-serving governments are over
item.author: Ariana Yekrangi
item.description: As CO2 emissions hit a 10-million-year high, people in 185 countries unite across continents to protest political inaction on this urgent crisis.
